column4: When 9.10 comes out, can I upgrade my previous version to it (I run 8.04)?
Or do I have to reinstall?
youll have to upgrade through the other versions
or reinstall. either one. skipping releases on upgrade is not supported except to go from one LTS to another. the next being 10.04
so every 6 months I must reinstall?
you can upgrade
but you cannot upgrade from 8.04 to 9.10 because 8.10 and 9.04 happened in between
you can upgrade through 8.10 and 9.04
or every 6 months upgrade as new versions are released
or every 2 years upgrade as new LTS versions are released
but distances > 6 months and < 2 years require more work
by upgrade through, i men tell 8.04 to go to 8.10, then tell 8.10 to go to 9.04, then tell 9.04 to go to 9.10
does upgrading to the new 6 month version require manual effort on my part, or does Ubuntu include the necessaries when I use the update tools?
its in the update tools
in system -> administration -> software sources, there is an option to either notify you about all new versions, only new LTS verisons, or not at all
thanks
set it to the all new versions setting, and it should offer to go to 8.10
er the second it = the update manager
why does it require more effort to upgrade to the next LTS?
one LTS to the next LTS is a single upgrade. its easy
its when you want to go from 1 version to another where they are *not* both LTS and also not sequential that its more annoying
the effort required to make skipping releases easy is somethng that is only expended for LTS
